profileText: A Senator from Nevada; born in Cape Girardeau, Cape Girardeau County, Mo., November 30, 1928; graduated, Washington University, St. Louis, Mo., 1949; United States Army Intelligence Corps, special agent 1951-1953; named to Army Intelligence Hall of Fame in 1988; businessman and banker; member, Nevada State senate 1967-1975; elected as a Republican to the United States Senate in 1982 and served from January 3, 1983, to January 3, 1989; unsuccessful candidate for reelection in 1988; Ambassador to the Bahamas, 1989-1993; returned to private life in Nevada; was a resident of Las Vegas at the time of his death, due to prostate cancer complications, on May 15, 2006.

researchRecord.name: 1983-1988. 60 linear feet. Congressional and personal papers and correspondence, press files, legislative files, administrative files, and speeches. Topics include civil service, commerce, defense, projects, health and welfare, judiciary, labor, Nevada issues, and trade. Finding aid.
